intro: Pleomele timorensis, commonly known as the Timor pleomele, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to the island of Timor and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and compact growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
